items.title: 'Zorgen bij Real Madrid om knieblessure Mbapp√©'
items.summary: Kylian Mbapp√© (27) staat voorlopig aan de kant na het oplopen van een kniebandblessure, zo meldt L‚Äô√âquipe . De spits van Real Madrid heeft zijn kruisband niet gescheurd, maar een MRI-scan wees wel uit dat sprake is van een blessure aan een buitenband, waarvoor behandeling en rust nodig zijn. Mbapp√© zal naar verwachting minimaal drie weken ontbreken.

items.title: Dazn ordered to honour ‚Ç¨84m Belgian football TV deal after terminating contract
items.summary: Dazn must resume ‚Ç¨6.6m-a-month payments It said agreement was not viable without carriage deal Dazn has been ordered to honour the remainder of an ‚Ç¨84.2m (¬£73.5m) TV deal with Belgium‚Äôs Pro League this season after the streaming service announced last month it was terminating the contract. In a judgment from Belgium‚Äôs centre for arbitration and mediation (Cepani), sent to the clubs on Wednesday morning, Dazn has been told it must continue broadcasting and paying for the Pro League until 30 June, unless Cepani declares otherwise. That would cost it about ‚Ç¨53m. Continue reading...

items.title: Martin √òdegaard relocates his missing rhythm to dictate Arsenal‚Äôs tempo again
items.summary: Rejuvenated by his goal on Saturday and free from injuries that have disrupted his season, Arsenal‚Äôs captain led their destruction of Villa When Arsenal really needed Martin √òdegaard, the captain finally rediscovered his magic touch. Gabriel Magalh√£es had just opened the scoring against Aston Villa after a first half in which Mikel Arteta‚Äôs nervous side were struggling without the influential Declan Rice. Then it happened. Jadon Sancho was waiting to receive a pass from Youri Tielemens inside Villa‚Äôs half but, before the forward knew it, √òdegaard had pinched the ball and was haring towards Emiliano Mart√≠nez‚Äôs goal. A jink back on to his left foot fooled Tielemens and allowed √òdegaard to play through the perfect through ball for Mart√≠n Zubimendi to score the crucial second. It was the fifth goal or assist that Zubimendi has contributed to since he joined in the summer ‚Äì the joint-best return of his club career ‚Äì and the Spaniard‚Äôs impact was rightly hailed by a delighted Arteta. ‚ÄúCredit to his teammates as well, how easy they make it for him,‚Äù said the Arsenal manager in a nod to √òdegaard. Continue reading...

items.title: Joshua spends second night in hospital after fatal car crash in Nigeria
items.summary: Anthony Joshua remains in a Nigerian hospital recovering from the car crash that killed two of the British boxer's close friends.

items.title: African football hit by fresh allegations over general secretary‚Äôs Caf conduct
items.summary: Gabonese FA president was voted on to Caf exco in 2023 Caf chief allegedly failed to act on reports of sexual abuse The general secretary of the Confederation of African Football (Caf), Veron Mosengo-Omba, ignored a recommendation that Pierre-Alain Mounguengui was ineligible for election to its powerful executive committee because he had been accused of covering up widespread sexual abuse in Gabonese football, it can be revealed. Mounguengui, the president of the Gabonese football federation (Fegafoot), has been accused of failing to act on reports of sexual abuse and rape of young footballers in a series of stories that were first published by the Guardian in 2021. He has denied the allegations and there is no suggestion Mounguengui has been accused of sexual abuse himself. Although he has not yet been formally charged, Mounguengui spent six months in custody awaiting a decision from the authorities in Gabon and was visited by the Caf president, Patrice Motsepe, with a final ruling on his case still pending almost four years on. Continue reading...

items.title: January transfer window 2026: what every Premier League club needs
items.summary: Aston Villa have a decision to make about Harvey Elliott, Brentford have money to spend and Burnley and Everton need goalscorers A busy summer with the arrival of more than ¬£250m in reinforcements has proved to be invaluable given the number of injuries that have hit Arsenal, particularly in defence. But that also makes any more expensive incomings unlikely in January, especially after the timely return of the influential Gabriel Magalh√£es this week. A loan signing or two could be on the cards, however, with Arsenal not having filled either slot so far after bringing in Neto from Bournemouth and Raheem Sterling from Chelsea last season. Mikel Arteta could do with more cover at right-back and must also decide whether to allow Ethan Nwaneri to go on loan with the 18-year-old having made only three starts in all competitions. Ed Aarons Continue reading...

items.title: From breakups to contract minefields: it‚Äôs make or break time for academy players
items.summary: Young footballers have big decisions to make at this time of year as academy directors aim to sign the most talented Any 15- or 16-year-olds who should be revising for their mock GCSEs are probably finding that the end of December is a testing time of year. For those in academy football, it can often be make or break. While the very best ‚Äì such as Arsenal‚Äôs record-breaking Max Dowman, who made headlines in October when he agreed terms on a scholarship deal ‚Äì secured their futures in good time, many discovered their fates just before the 31 December deadline. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs always the sort of classic breakup. It‚Äôs not you, it‚Äôs us,‚Äù says Dr Chris Platts, who has studied the academy system for more than a decade and offers support to young players and their families. ‚ÄúBeing released before Christmas isn‚Äôt nice for a kid. Then they‚Äôve got about five months before their GCSEs and those five months are now going to include a lot of trials and uncertainty going into the following year.‚Äù Continue reading...
